ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral Otosclerosis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient history of otosclerosis, prior stapedectomy (left ear), family history, and audiometric findings of mixed hearing loss with air-bone gaps.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Noise-Induced Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of noise exposure from hunting likely contributes to the sensorineural component of the hearing loss.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition ability.
Standard test for middle ear function, though contraindicated in this specific visit due to prior surgery.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with bilateral mixed hearing loss, severe in the right ear and mild to moderately severe in the left ear. Significant air-bone gaps are present. Speech reception thresholds align with pure-tone averages, and word recognition is good bilaterally at elevated levels. Immittance was not performed due to prior surgery.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Severe mixed hearing loss (PTA 72 dB HL). Left ear: Mild to moderately severe mixed hearing loss (PTA 43 dB HL). Significant air-bone gaps bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 75 dB HL, WRS 88% at 95 dB HL. Left SRT 50 dB HL, WRS 90% at 75 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Not measured due to previous otosurgery.

counseling_actions: Recommend hearing aid trial before considering further otosurgery
Discuss benefits of binaural BTE amplification versus current single ITC device
Counsel on the importance of hearing protection during noise exposure

escalation.rationale_short: For medical management of otosclerosis and consideration of surgery versus amplification.

expected_outcome: Patient was fit with binaural BTE hearing aids.
Patient perceived significant benefit from her hearing aids.
